str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.
A herald, preacher, proclaimer. From kerusso; a herald, i.e. Of divine truth.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
A teacher, master. From didasko; an instructor.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To deceive, lie, speak falsely. Middle voice of an apparently primary verb; to utter an untruth or attempt to deceive by falsehood.
